meanings.definition: The insertion of days or months into a calendar to adjust for inaccuracies.
meanings.sent1: The intercalations in the calendar helped keep track of time accurately.
meanings.sent2: The intercalations in the schedule made sure all events were properly spaced out.
meanings.sent3: The intercalations in the planner prevented any overlapping of important dates.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter acted as intercalations in the serious meeting, breaking the tension.
meanings.sent5: The intercalations of colorful illustrations in the book made it more engaging.

meanings.definition: The act of inserting something between other things.
meanings.sent1: Careful intercalations of notes between the pages kept her organized.
meanings.sent2: The intercalations of new ideas into the discussion sparked creativity.
meanings.sent3: His intercalations of jokes during the lecture lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: The intercalations of spices in the recipe enhanced the flavor.
meanings.sent5: The intercalations of pauses in his speech added emphasis to his points.

meanings.definition: The process of interposing or introducing something additional.
meanings.sent1: The intercalations of new characters in the story enriched the plot.
meanings.sent2: Her intercalations of personal anecdotes made the presentation more relatable.
meanings.sent3: The intercalations of unexpected twists in the movie kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent4: The intercalations of music in the scene heightened the emotional impact.
meanings.sent5: His intercalations of historical facts provided context to the discussion.
